intro: Holosteum mucronatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf holosteum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and smartweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive mucronate tip, giving it its scientific name. Holosteum mucronatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
